link.Abstract: If we learned one thing from Liam Hemsworth's Details interview, it's that the dude is easily distracted by squirrels. Funny, we're easily distracted by Liam Hemsworth. But who's cuter?! We're pretty sure we know how the Hunger Games star will be voting, but we'll let you decide. For each slide, cast your vote!
link.title: Who's Cuter: Liam Hemsworth or a Squirrel?

link.title: 10 Things We Learned From Kermit the Frog's Toronto Press Conference

content.div:
As the stars of the Hunger Games continue their U.S. mall tour (they'll be in Miami and Dallas today), the likes of Jennifer Lawrence, Liam Hemsworth and Josh Hutcherson don't need much help winning people over. (We're just going to go ahead and assume all that high-decibel squealing is friendly.)

In the movie, though, Lawrence and Hutcherson's characters -- District 12 tributes Katniss and Peeta -- receive some professional PR guidance from an expert named Cinna. Played by Lenny Kravitz, a just-released clip from the much-anticipated flick offers our first real look at District 12's lead stylist in action.

If you're hoping to watch a makeover montage worthy of Clueless (or Clone High), somebody needs to pick up Suzanne Collins' best-selling trilogy, already. As Cinna tells Katniss in this sneak peek, he's not here to make her look pretty, his job is helping her "make an impression" -- one that could ultimately save her life as she enters the Hunger Games tournament.

Watch it below. The Hunger Games reaches theatres March 23, and you'd think Cinna himself was behind the adventure movie's marketing. The buzz (this article included, we suppose), is relentless -- which has already translated into record-breaking ticket sales. (Hunger Games beat Twilight: Eclipse's claim to the biggest first-day online pre-sales when tickets became available in late February.) That's enough to hitch anyone to a story about the televised mass murder of minors -- including the Muppets, who've released a spoofy ad that ostensibly has something to do with the Hunger Games (or at least its movie poster fonts) -- and everything to do with the fact they want you to see it in theatres for the kajillionth time. It's posted below.

But first, check out Katniss' first meeting with Cinna:

The Muppets "spoof" The Hunger Games:

leahc@dose.ca
